title: Online Shop Logo ::: opinions please.
content:
Hello folks;

Ever since I moved I’ve been a bit disconnected from my usual design community... hence the guys that always critique my work.

I ran across this place-of-joyfull-&-merry-meet\_\_\_I believe I’ll stay... if you allow it.

I’m needing some input on a logo design. More like, post-commentary since it has already been approved.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Copy of logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016222915/http:/typophile.com/files/Copy%20of%20logo.gif) | 2.93 KB |

 [‹ Gatorade Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016222915/http:/typophile.com/node/14631 "Go to previous forum topic") [tell me what you think ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071016222915/http:/typophile.com/node/14558 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Dbolivar

comments.content: My only problem with you logo is when your client has to make out the check. Is it Decals.com or is it TSEB Decals. Make sure your clients know which it is.
Perhaps if you just slightly curl the upper left corner of the logo, it might be enough of a visual clue of a decal being pealed back.

I read TSEB initially as well. Perhaps mirror ’best’ as a whole rather than letter-by-letter.

Also, adding the extra ’dot’ in the middle isn’t a great idea if it’s supposed to act as a URL.

As for one-stop decal shop, are there decal shops that require multiple tops?

I like norberts idea, too.
